entry.title: Re: I want to change the background color when there is n...
entry.content:
@N1kh1l 
Thank you for your reply.

The idea you gave me‚Äîsetting the table background color to gray and using a threshold to change the background color when a value is present‚Äîwas very helpful.

I will outline the steps I took based on your idea.
1. Set the background color of the data area to gray.
2. Create a threshold with a significantly larger maximum value (create a threshold applied when the value is less than or equal to the maximum value).
If the threshold is met, set the background color to white. As a result, when the value is NULL (displayed as -), the background color remains gray.
When the value is not NULL (a value exists), the background color now displays as white.


Thanks & Regards,
tsuuuu

entry.title: Re: Purchase requisition creation currency error
entry.content:
Even though the transaction currency is PHP, SAP may still attempt to convert values to another currency for one of the following reasons:

1. Controlling Area Currency
If your Controlling Area is set to INR, SAP will try to convert the PR value from PHP to INR for internal cost tracking. This happens especially when the Controlling Area currency ‚â† Company Code currency.

2. Exchange Rate Type M
SAP uses exchange rate type M (standard market rate) by default for conversions. If no rate is maintained for INR/PHP on the specified date (19.08.2025), the system throws the error.

3. Missing Currency Pair in TCURR
You mentioned TCURR has PHP to EUR, but INR/PHP is missing. That‚Äôs exactly why the system can‚Äôt perform the conversion ‚Äî it needs that rate to proceed.

To fix this issue, check the following:

  • Go to transaction OKEQ or Manage Controlling Area app. Confirm the Controlling Area currency; if it is INR, that‚Äôs your trigger.
  • Use transaction OB08 to maintain the INR/PHP rate for rate type M on or before 19.08.2025. You can also maintain PHP/INR if needed ‚Äî SAP can reverse the rate if configured.
  • Check the purchase requisition document type and account assignment ‚Äî some configurations may force currency conversion for valuation.

entry.title: Re: Custom Tile Visualization & Navigation in SAP Build Workzone - Cloud foundry launchpad: Solv
entry.content:
Hi @Yogeshwaran_Sai ! I have never used Neo environment and have only recently started using Cloud Foundry. Yet I've managed to find a solution to use a tile as a "Custom App Launcher". I uploaded a custom UI card using a content-package to create a tile, and then, through the content-package, added a navigation.

First I followed this long tutorial to create the UI card + content-package deployment
Integrate a UI integration Card to SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition | SAP Tutorials

and then I used crossnavigation to link it to the app (in the example, the test app was called simpleHello):

"crossNavigation": {
  "inbounds": {
    "simpleHello-show": {
      "semanticObject": "simpleHello",
      "action": "show",
      "title": "{{simpleHello-show.flpTitle}}",
      "signature": {
        "parameters": {},
        "additionalParameters": "allowed"
      },
      "resolutionResult": {
        "applicationType": "SAPUI5",
        "additionalInformation": "SAPUI5.Component=sap.btp.testappforcard",
        "url": "/sapbtptestappforcard/"
      }
    }
  }
}


Hope that helped!
 (maybe it's not the best practice though, but it works üôÇ )

entry.title: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in Warehouse Monitor vs MMBE in SAP Public Cloud.
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

While receiving material with batch-specific UOM through synchronous goods receipt in Warehouse Management in SAP Public Cloud, I observed an issue.

The base UOM for the material is TO, and the alternative UOM is EA. I am receiving the material in EA with a batch-specific UOM ratio, where each EA is considered as a handling unit. However, when I check the received quantity in the Warehouse Monitor app, the EA is displayed according to the batch-specific UOM ratio instead of reflecting the actual received quantity in EA.

On the other hand, when I check in MMBE, the receiving quantity is displayed correctly.

Could you please advise on the reason for this discrepancy and the possible resolution?

entry.title: Re: SAP table PTRV_VENDOR_SYNC different S4Coreop 106 and...
entry.content:
From your post, I presume that either the refactored logic is not yet exposed via DDIC structures in SP 0003, or SAP has moved the configuration to a different layer, possibly embedded in CVI (Customer-Vendor Integration) or BP role synchronization logic.

Please try with the below workarounds

Go to SPRO ‚Üí Cross-Application Components ‚Üí Master Data Synchronization ‚Üí Synchronize Employee to Business Partner. This area now governs much of the HR-to-BP sync logic, including vendor role assignment and reference BP handling.

Some of the synchronization settings may now be managed via Central Business Configuration (CBC) or Fiori apps rather than classic SPRO nodes. Look for apps like Manage Business Partner Synchronization and Maintain Employee Vendor Mapping.

If the standard sync logic is too limited implement a BAdI such as BADI_CVI_CUSTOM_MAPPER or BADI_CVI_MAPPING to inject custom logic for:

  • Reference BP assignment
  • Blocking/unblocking logic
  • Bank ID mapping

This gives you full control over how HR infotype data is transformed into BP/vendor master data.

Finally, since the DDIC structures are missing and the SPRO path is unclear, raise an SAP support ticket referencing your upgrade path and missing functionality.

So the proposal summary is

entry.title: Re: ECC EHP4 to EHP8 upgrade phase PREP_INSTALL/SUBMOD_PR...
entry.content:
ok, and point 3 of the sap note is also already done?

 If none of the above helped, make sure both users ops$<sid>adm and ops$ora<sid> have tablespace quota and RESOURCE privileges.

sqlplus / as sysdba
SQL> grant unlimited tablespace to <user>;
SQL> grant resource to <user>;
SQL> drop user sapsr3hd cascade;

 

furthermore there was a similar issue in following thread 

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/cannot-create-database-shadow-user-sapsr3shd/qaq-p/10278842

 

It did not work at once. We additionally executed the following.

Schema User = SAPERP in our environment.

create user SAPERPSHD identified by <PW>;
grant sapconn to SAPERPSHD;
brconnect -u / -c -f chpass -o SAPERPSHD -p <PW>;

CONNECT SAPERPSHD/<PW>;

1. brtools -c
2. 8 - Additional functions
3. 4 - Change password of database user
4. 3 ~ Database owner to change password (owner)
5. fill in ther new user, which pw you'd like to change e.g. SAPERPSHD
6. c
7. new PW
8. again new PW

This worked in our SUM upgrade.

entry.title: While resubmitting a document do not send is not available in the output settings
entry.content:
after scoping the do not send additional output option you created i.e. a customer invoice with send by:do not send.

 

In the initial output history it is shown as such, but if you resubmit do not send is not available.

This is correct as you already have an output as do not send.

In this case the option would not be available.

In case the initial output was i.e email or printer the do not send option is also not available.

Only for initial outputs do not send is applicable.

entry.title: Seeing "Bad Installation" error while loading the retrieved universe using BO Semantic Layer SDK
entry.content:
com.sap.tools.commons.exception.NestedException: Interface requested not found : csLIB
at com.sap.tools.commons.exception.NestedException.create(Unknown Source)
at com.businessobjects.mds.services.parser.decoder.DataFoundationSQLDecoder.getPRM(DataFoundationSQLDecoder.java:82)
at com.businessobjects.mds.services.parser.decoder.DataFoundationSQLDecoder.<init>(DataFoundationSQLDecoder.java:97)
at com.businessobjects.mds.services.parser.decoder.UniverseSQLDecoder.<init>(UniverseSQLDecoder.java:40)
at com.sap.sl.sdk.authoring.businesslayer.internal.services.MdsToSdkBusinessLayerConverter.createSdkModel(MdsToSdkBusinessLayerConverter.java:246)
at com.sap.sl.sdk.authoring.businesslayer.internal.services.BusinessLayerModelToModel.createSdkModel(BusinessLayerModelToModel.java:31)
at com.sap.sl.sdk.authoring.local.internal.services.LocalResourceServiceImpl.createSdkBusinessLayer(LocalResourceServiceImpl.java:217)
at com.sap.sl.sdk.authoring.local.internal.services.LocalResourceServiceImpl.loadInternal(LocalResourceServiceImpl.java:196)
at com.sap.sl.sdk.authoring.local.internal.services.LocalResourceServiceImpl.load(LocalResourceServiceImpl.java:129)
at Tester.main(Tester.java:44)
Caused by: com.sap.connectivity.cs.core.CSError: Interface requested not found : csLIB
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.extended.ImplementationManager.getImplementation(ImplementationManager.java:154)
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.extended.ImplementationManager.getConfiguration(ImplementationManager.java:195)
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.extended.NLDBProvider.populateMap(NLDBProvider.java:51)
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.extended.NLDBProvider.getManager(NLDBProvider.java:177)
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.extended.Provider.getEnvironment(Provider.java:93)
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.extended.ConnectionServer.JobProfile(ConnectionServer.java:572)
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.api.trace.EnvironmentLogger.JobProfile(EnvironmentLogger.java:614)
at com.businessobjects.mds.services.relational.PrmProperties.getDbParameterSet(PrmProperties.java:1500)
at com.businessobjects.mds.services.relational.PrmProperties.loadFunctions(PrmProperties.java:1543)
at com.businessobjects.mds.services.relational.PrmProperties.loadParameters(PrmProperties.java:1517)
at com.businessobjects.mds.services.relational.PrmProperties.<init>(PrmProperties.java:185)
at com.businessobjects.mds.services.relational.CsService.getPRMProperties(CsService.java:1458)
at com.businessobjects.mds.services.parser.decoder.DataFoundationSQLDecoder.getPRM(DataFoundationSQLDecoder.java:80)
... 8 more
Caused by: com.businessobjects.connectionserver.CSError: Bad Installation
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.library.ConnectionServer.initialize(Native Method)
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.library.ConnectionServer.<init>(ConnectionServer.java:77)
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.library.ConnectionServer.getInstance(ConnectionServer.java:338)
at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DirectMethodHandleAccessor.invoke(DirectMethodHandleAccessor.java:103)
at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:580)
at com.businessobjects.connectionserver.ConnectionServer.getInstance(ConnectionServer.java:142)
at com.sap.connectivity.cs.extended.ImplementationManager.getImplementation(ImplementationManager.java:144)
... 20 more


I am running it as a Java project in Intellij. I have added -Dbusinessobjects.connectivity.directory and -Djava.library.path to JVM and also imported all the JARs from the BO installation directories into the project workspace. I am able to retrieve the universe files (BLX, DFX and CNS). Furthermore, when I digged deeper using debug mode, it seems to have fetched the tables, joins etc., successfully. The errors start after getting to getPRMProperties and beyond. Because of that, there is no way to extract the fetched items as the error appears in the later part of the same flow. 

Code Snippet:

SlContext context = SlContext.create();
        IEnterpriseSession enterpriseSession = null;
        try {
            System.out.println("Connecting...");
            ISessionMgr sessionMgr = CrystalEnterprise.getSessionMgr();
            enterpriseSession = sessionMgr.logon(username, password, BOSERVER, AUTH);
            CmsSessionService cmsSessionService = context.getService(CmsSessionService.class);
            cmsSessionService.setSession(enterpriseSession);
            System.out.println("Connected.");
            CmsResourceService cmsService =
                    context.getService(CmsResourceService.class);
            LocalResourceService localResourceService =
                    context.getService(LocalResourceService.class);
            System.out.println("Importing universe");
            String blxPath =
                    cmsService.retrieveUniverse(CMS_PATH, tempFolder, true);
            System.out.println("Universe imported to " + blxPath);
            RelationalBusinessLayer businessLayer = (RelationalBusinessLayer) localResourceService.load(blxPath);
            String dfxPath = businessLayer.getDataFoundationPath();
            DataFoundation dataFoundation =
                    (DataFoundation) localResourceService.load(dfxPath);
            for(Parameter param : dataFoundation.getParameters() ) {
                System.out.println("Parameter: " + param.getName());
            }
            String tableName = dataFoundation.getTables().get(0).getName();
            System.out.println("Tables fetched successful. First table name: " + tableName);
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }

entry.title: Re: How to extract SAP BO - Is it necessary to unzip the...
entry.content:
The audit data is not encrypted.  As long as you can access the database you should have no problem reading the ads_* tables.

But using audit data for access details is not ideal, since it only records audited events.  To track which users and groups have access to content, you'll need to extract from the CMS.  That is encrypted and can't easily be retrieved directly from the CMS database.

entry.title: Re: Automatic and Manual Payment Errors in SAP S/4HANA Cl...
entry.content:
Dear @MariaIsabelPaz ,

If the steps outlined in KBA 3444334 do not resolve the issue, please verify the configuration in the activity ‚ÄúSet Up Bank Determination for Payment Transactions‚Äù (Configuration ID 101045).

In addition, ensure that the same house bank is not defined in both ‚ÄúBank Accounts‚Äù and ‚ÄúBank Accounts (Enhanced)‚Äù. Please adjust the configuration accordingly and execute the payment run again.

 

 

If you need any further assistance, please let me know

 

Thank you and BR

Dilan

entry.title: Unloading point and Recipient are not filled when Item category is D in Purchase requisition - ME51N
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

In transaction ME51N (Purchase Requisition), when I use account assignment category K together with item category D, the fields Unloading Point and Recipient on the Account Assignment tab cannot be filled. The values are entered but are automatically deleted.

If I remove item category D, then both fields can be maintained without any issue.
In ME21N (Purchase Order) this works fine.

I also checked the BAdI IF_EX_ME_PROCESS_REQ_CUST~FIELDSELECTION_ITEM, and I noticed that these two fields are set as mandatory there ( <fs>-fieldstatus = '+' ).

My questions:

Is it possible to have this functionality in Purchase Requisitions as well?

If yes, how can this be achieved ‚Äì through SPRO customizing, or is it handled somewhere in the code?

Thanks in advance for any insights!

Best regards,

Nejla

entry.title: Re: UDT creation fails in SBODemoAU database
entry.content:
Hello,

 

The business objects that create user tables and user fields are a bit clumsy with memory allocation.

Please post the code in here. But the general rule that I use is to put the creation of fields and tables inside a try/finally block and in the finally block I call these 2 methods:

Marshal.ReleaseComObject(userField); //or userTable
GC.Collect();

 

Best regards

entry.title: Re: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in War...
entry.content:
Hello @SNarayan 

In SAP S/4HANA public cloud edition, there is no single setting to prevent back-dated billing documents (like VF01). Instead, there are several options supported, including.

Validation during Billing Document Creation

  • You can use the Cloud BAdI Billing Document ‚Äì Check Before Save SD_BIL_DOC_SAVE_CHECK to implement a date validation.
  • Consequently, the system generates an error if the billing date is earlier than the current system date, preventing the save.
  • Check this SAP Documentation: SAP Help ‚Äì BAdIs for Sales Billing

Control at the accounting level

    • To prevent postings into earlier periods, you can enforce this by keeping the posting periods closed in. Manage Posting Periods (App ID F2293).
    • Additionally, you can utilise the SAP Help-Manage Substitution/Validation Rules to halt postings where the accounting date is before today. This functions when billing has already been transferred to accounting.

Governance at UI Level

  • In the Create Billing Documents (Fiori app F0798), you can default the billing date to today and make the field non-editable for most users with UI Adaptation.

SAP Best Practice:

  • If you require a hard stop on any invoice dated before today, use the BAdI check.
  • If you only want to prevent prior-period postings, manage it through posting period control.
  • For governance with minimal effort, set today‚Äôs date as default and restrict editing through UI adjustments.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in Warehouse Monitor vs MMBE in SAP Public Cloud.
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

While receiving material with batch-specific UOM through synchronous goods receipt in Warehouse Management in SAP Public Cloud, I observed an issue.

The base UOM for the material is TO, and the alternative UOM is EA. I am receiving the material in EA with a batch-specific UOM ratio, where each EA is considered as a handling unit. However, when I check the received quantity in the Warehouse Monitor app, the EA is displayed according to the batch-specific UOM ratio instead of reflecting the actual received quantity in EA.

On the other hand, when I check in MMBE, the receiving quantity is displayed correctly.

Could you please advise on the reason for this discrepancy and the possible resolution?

For reference i have attached some images - Please review.

entry.title: White Space, Begone! New Pilot Removes Widgets Column from Blog Posts
entry.content:
For as long as I can remember, even going back to the previous SAP Community platform, members have asked us to reduce the amount of white space on post pages, arguing that the layout makes readability more difficult. It‚Äôs a complaint that continues today ‚Äì and one that we‚Äôre taking steps to address.

The current platform includes a column for widgets (e.g., Top Kudoed Authors), but, depending on the length of a blog post, that column might be mostly blank. For that reason, members have requested its removal, and we‚Äôre now testing the favorability of that approach.

To help illustrate the point, here‚Äôs a blog post with the widgets column:

Now here‚Äôs the very same post with the widgets column (and white space) removed:

What do you think? Better? Worse? Don‚Äôt care one way or the other? We‚Äôre running a four-week pilot (starting today) so you can let us know!

To experience a blog board free of the widgets column (and the white space that comes with), head on over to the Application Development and Automation group. We‚Äôre currently testing that look and feel over there to give members the opportunity to view blog posts without the widgets.

(Note: We are aware of issues with the formatting of some posts now that we've removed the widgets column. If this change affected the placement of images in your post, for example, you'll need to edit to correct. Per the "Blog Formatting Post-Migration" section of this post, it's best to use the blog tool as intended, making sure to avoid complicated html and to clear formatting when copying over text.)  

Compare the blog posts in the Application Development and Automation group to blog posts in other areas on the community. If you prefer the new widget-less layout, let us know in the comments below. Or, if you favor blog posts with widgets and the white space, make sure to share your opinions in the comments as well. We‚Äôll review all feedback received between today (Tuesday, August 26) and Tuesday, September 23, then determine which layout members seem to favor.

If enough members choose the new approach (with the widgets and space gone), we can update all blog boards to match what you see in the Application Development and Automation group. Then again, if members tell us to leave the current layout alone, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôll do (and we‚Äôll switch the Application Development and Automation posts back to match the other boards).

Will we change the status of this feedback item to ‚ÄúDelivered‚Äù? Or ‚ÄúDeclined‚Äù? You can help us decide!

With this pilot, we‚Äôre inviting members to provide feedback that will help influence the design of our site ‚Äì as it should be in a community that belongs to all of us.

We look forward to reading your input below!

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytics Cloud for planning - Strange behaviour...
entry.content:
Hello @guenay 

for me, it looks like there must still be some old values in the SAC model, on your master data combinations, which you want to plan.

To make sure, I would recommend trying to delete the model data for these combinations and then then retry again.

Usually, there is a "Rest distribution" if the values cannot be divided by 12 months... but this is then applied only to one month:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/fac0e8d372634024b7f2fb275ee98bc7.html?locale=en-US#rest-distribution 

Your situation looks more like data on one of the accounts, used in the formula.

BR, Martin

entry.title: SAP Datasphere - How to configure the AWS Assume Role option for an AWS S3 connection
entry.content:
I have been seeing questions on the S3 connection option to Assume Role in SAP Datasphere.  This article shows how I set up my S3 connection in SAP Datasphere to use this functionality. 

There are multiple methods to connect to AWS S3, this is one approach that may work for your environment.   SAP Datasphere can be deployed on multiple hyperscalers so this approach works for all deployments of SAP Datasphere.   The details for the S3 connection in SAP Datasphere are available in our help documentation. 

Disclaimer - I am not a deep AWS expert, please verify any security deployments with your AWS team.

 

I started with this AWS Reference link: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/code-library/latest/ug/iam_example_iam_Scenario_CreateUserAssumeRole_section.html

Summary: 

  • Create a S3 user with no permissions and secret key/access key
  • Create a role that grants permission to list Amazon S3 buckets for the account.
  • Add a policy to let the user assume the role
  • Assume the role and list S3 buckets using temporary credentials, then clean up resources.

FIrst we create a user with no permissions in AWS

Then create Access Keys for the user:

Note the keys down for use in the SAP Datasphere connection.  

Next, create a role that allows the sts:AssumeRole permission.  Capture the ARN for this role to be used in the SAP Datasphere connection. 

Here's the role I created, with my account ID removed:

Role
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Principal": {
                "AWS": "arn:aws:iam::<REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:user/assume_user_demo_no_permissions"
            },
            "Action": "sts:AssumeRole"
        }
    ]
}

 

Now create a Policy that exposes the AWS S3 bucket(s):

Here's the Policy definition I used - please adjust it if necessary based on your specific requirements:

 

Policy: 
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Sid": "VisualEditor0",
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Action": [
                "s3:ListTagsForResource",
                "s3:PutObject",
                "s3:GetObject",
                "s3:ListBucketMultipartUploads",
                "s3:PutObjectRetention",
                "s3:DeleteObjectVersion",
                "s3:GetObjectTagging",
                "s3:ListBucket",
                "s3:DeleteObject",
                "s3:GetBucketAcl",
                "s3:GetBucketPolicy"
            ],
            "Resource": [
                "arn:aws:s3:*:REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:access-grants/default/grant/*",
                "arn:aws:s3:::assume-role-bucket-dsp",
                "arn:aws:s3:::*/*",
                "arn:aws:s3:*:REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:storage-lens-group/*",
                "arn:aws:s3:*:REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:access-grants/default/location/*",
                "arn:aws:s3:*:REPLACE with your AWS Acct ID>:access-grants/default"
            ]
        },
        {
            "Sid": "VisualEditor1",
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Action": "s3:ListAllMyBuckets",
            "Resource": "*"
        }
    ]
}

Create the S3 Bucket Policy

 

Bucket Policy:

Bucket policy: 
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Effect": "Deny",
            "Principal": "*",
            "Action": "s3:*",
            "Resource": [
                "arn:aws:s3:::assume-role-bucket-dsp",
                "arn:aws:s3:::assume-role-bucket-dsp/*"
            ],
            "Condition": {
                "Bool": {
                    "aws:SecureTransport": "false"
                },
                "NumericLessThan": {
                    "s3:TlsVersion": "1.2"
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}

 

Now that you have the secret key/access key and ARN for the assume role, you can create the connection in SAP Datasphere..  Navigate to your Connections area within your Space and select Amazon Simple Storage Service:

Note the endpoint contains the region in format:   s3.<region>.amazonaws.com.   Enable Assume Role by changing the value of Use Assume Role to true and Include the Role ARN in the Assume Role section of the Connection. 

Save and Validate the connection in SAP Datasphere

If you used my Role and Policy, then using S3 as a target in Replication Flows will work!

Join Us for the First SAP Community Meetup in Casablanca!

We‚Äôre excited to welcome you to the launch of the SAP Community in Casablanca ‚Äî a space where SAP professionals, learners, and enthusiasts can connect, share insights, and create opportunities for collaboration.

entry.title: Re: How to filter data based on measure values in SAP Ana...
entry.content:
Hello @karteeksap 

I'm not 100% sure, since I had no such requirement before ... I probably would work with "Flop 50" for example.

However, it seems in the classic story, it worked directly via measure-based filter:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/e5b25f8eda49474ebee10746e2942176.html?locale=en-US

In the Optimized Story, it seems it works only via an account model:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/6057fb25f910493a8c81a68f52f32b2b.html?locale=en-US 

Maybe these links help you, testing the one or the other idea.

BR, Martin

entry.title: Re: Couldn't subscribe to Integration Suite. Try again. I...
entry.content:
If you are getting this message when subscribing to Integration Suite after deletion of a previous subscription, it is most probably due to runtime resources not cleaned up yet from the previous subscription. Usually, 30 to 60 minutes are enough for the clean up. 

If you are getting this message when subscribing for the first time, I can't think of any reasonable cause.

Feel free to post your ideas and requests at https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/2282.

Regards
Dimiter
